summary: In 2021, about 13% of people in the U.S. reported having a disability, including trouble walking, cognitive or hearing impairments, and difficulty living independently. People with disabilities also experience challenges accessing health care and may not always receive appropriate care. Our Q&A report shows that most health care providers would benefit from more training on meeting the needs of people with disabilities—even though such training...
title: People with Disabilities: Information on the Health Care Workforce and Provider Training
